result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Neil A Gross was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Neil A Gross was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Huber privileges for work are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. First 45 days in jail and remainder on home detention, must begin today.
Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Neil A Gross
Current: 5108 Camp Phillips Road, #3, Weston, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 04-11-2016)
Prior: 6406 Richards Ave, Schofield, WI 54476
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

3:04 p.m Defendant Neil A Gross in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
15TR765: fine
15TR766: fine
15TR767: to be DRI
15CM124: Ct 1: 75 days jail, $1,200 fine + costs, $26.45 blood draw fee, 31 mo Revocation of license, 31 mo IID, DOT/AODA assessment
15CM124: Ct 2: to be dismissed
15CM124: Ct 3: $50 fine + costs + DNA surcharge
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15TR765: No contest
15TR766: No Contest
15CM124 ct 1: No Contest
15CM124 Ct 3: no contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15TR765, 15TR766, 15CM124 Ct 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CM124: Ct 2 is Dismissed and 15TR767 is Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests 60 day jail w/huber and able to serve it in  Marathon county if they agree, bond on file to be applied and 1 day jail credit. Motion for half priced IID request Court to sign.

BY THE COURT:*****
15CM124 Ct 1:
60 days jail, 1 day credit, Huber for work, first 45 days in jail and remainder on home detention, must begin today.
$1,820.00 fine - bond to be applied 60 days to pay balance or set up payment plan
$26.45 blood draw fee, 
31 mo Revocation, retroactive
31 mo IID, efective today
DOT/AODA assessment

15CM124 Ct 3:
$50 fine + costs + DNA surcharge

15TR765: $263.50 pay in 60 days or set up payment plan
15TR766: $10.00 fine

Defendant Neil A Gross in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court enters NOT GUILTY pleas. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Cash bond of $750.00
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs during pendency of this action.    Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  all scheduled court dates.

11:53 a.m. case is called.
ADA Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of  OWI 3rd, resisting or obstructing an officer and refused a PBT.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a cash bond of $750.  with conditions as stated.  

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  3-30-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch1
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 


BTC:
Cash bond of $750.00
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs during pendency of this action.    Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  all scheduled court dates.

Defendant states he lives in Schofield.  Defendant questions whether he can report to the Attic in Schofield.  
Court denies that request.

11:58 a.m. case is concluded.
